South London University’s Computing school wishes to set up a database to manage its external
speaker and placements processes. This is all part of developing links with local businesses and
giving students the opportunity to get some industry experience.
At present, individual members of the teaching team organise guest lectures, but this is all done in a
rather random fashion. They might use their personal contacts or meet an interesting speaker at an
external event and invite him/her to give a lecture or run a workshop for their students. If the
speaker agrees, then the lecturer will contact the timetabling unit to arrange a suitable date, time
and room for the lecture and then announce details of the event through the Blackboard
announcement system.
With the increasing emphasis on giving students ‘real world’ experiences, more and more of these
events are being run and the school wishes to make the most of the contacts they have and which
topics these contacts have expressed an interest in talking about. Unfortunately, these contacts and
speakers are not stored centrally, which leads to problems, for example:
• There have been occasions where multiple guest lectures have been arranged in one week
for a particular cohort of students, as each of the teaching staff concerned had no idea of
the other lecturers’ arrangements.
• A number of guest lectures were arranged on the same topic, thereby duplicating the
content of a previous lecture.
• Staff have independently invited speakers from the same company.
• Staff members have contacted an organisation to ask if it would consider offering
placement/workshop/ guest lecture etc, to find that the contact has already been
approached and has turned down the request - so is annoyed that he/she is being targeted
again.
• Staff members wanted to re-run specific guest lectures in a subsequent year for a new
cohort of students, but the staff member who had arranged the original lecture had left the
university without leaving details of the contact.
• Students have turned up to the staff room wanting to know where a lecture was being held.
etc.. etc..
The school is very keen to set up a database as it feels that if everything is centrally stored it will be
able eradicate such problems and to use the contacts to greater advantage, for example to see if a
speaker (or someone within their organisation) would be interested in providing placements/job
experience or live projects for students, as well as guest lectures. The Head of School hopes that a
sensible timetable can be put together showing the guest lectures for the whole of a semester which
students and teaching staff could access. He would also like to monitor attendance at each of the
lectures/workshops and also to collect any positive or negative feedback from students to see how
popular the talk has been, which might indicate whether to re-run a particular talk the following
year.
5
The Head of Computing has suggested that, with a new system, teaching staff could put in requests
for a guest lecture on a particular topic, and the system administrator might then be able to suggest
a suitable external speaker for that topic from information held in the database.
A small number of companies are already supplying ‘live’ projects to the department and the Head
of School hopes that a lot more can be found. The details of these also need to be stored centrally,
together with the member of staff who is running the live project. At present nobody knows who is
doing what. The marketing manager for the school would also like to know about these live projects
and their outcomes – if completed successfully, they could raise some good publicity for the
university. The new system should have some mechanism for informing the marketing manager that
the project has completed so that timely publicity materials can be produced.
The Head of School would also like there to be a designated staff member for each organisation,
responsible for nurturing and developing links with the organisation. Anyone wishing to contact a
company would need to liaise with the designated staff contact person. Members of staff should
have easy access to this information. The system should also be able to store a history of the
contacts made with each company and the reason for that contact, which teaching staff could refer
to.
The placement officer for the school also wants to maintain a database of placement or job
experience opportunities provided by organisations, and which students have been successful in
getting these placements, so that these students could be invited to talk to the student cohort on
their return from placement – again this is all part of getting students ready for the world of work.
School administrators will also benefit from this as currently they often unaware of which students
are doing placements. The new system will be able to clearly show which students are on placement
and who their designated supervisor is at their placement company (which may be different for each
student).
The Head of School and administrator think that useful reports could be generated from the
proposed database, for example to show how the school is interacting with businesses and the local
community, which lecturer has made the most effort at developing links with industry (and who
hasn’t bothered at all…), and many other outputs.
All in all, the current system is a mess and you have been called in to sort it out. The above
description is just a basic outline of some of the issues and problems. You can make any sensible
assumptions to fill in any gaps. Good luck!

using Turings reaction diffusion model create a mathematical model for human population growth, where the reaction is population and the diffusion is information. When population increases then information increases then population increases. If population is approaching the carrying capacity then information increase causes slowing down of population increase

The first equation describes how the population changes due to growth, limited by the environment’s carrying capacity (K), and due to information. The second equation describes how information changes due to the diffusion of information and its influence on population growth (such as technological advancements).

To model human population growth considering environmental carrying capacity and the influence of information, we can consider the following system of two PDEs:

(1) ∂P/∂t = rP(1 - P/K) + aI(1 - P/K)
(2) ∂I/∂t = D∇²I - bP + cI

Here:

- r is the intrinsic growth rate of the population.
- K is the carrying capacity of the environment.
- a is a constant representing the positive effect of information on population growth.
- D is the diffusion coefficient of information.
- ∇² is the Laplacian operator, which measures the spatial diffusion of information.
- b is a constant representing the effect of population on information accumulation.
- c is a constant representing the natural decay rate of the information.

The model above assumes that population growth is limited by the environment’s carrying capacity (logistic growth) and that information has a positive effect on population growth, which becomes weaker as the population approaches the carrying capacity. In addition, the model assumes that the accumulation of information depends on the population, and the spatial diffusion of information is represented by the Laplacian operator, which ensures a proper spread and exchange of information across regions.

To solve the system of PDEs, appropriate initial and boundary conditions must be specified. For a real-world application, one needs to find empirical data to estimate the parameters r, K, a, D, b, and c. Such a model can be solved using standard numerical methods, such as finite difference or finite element methods.

In summary, Turing’s reaction-diffusion model can be adapted to study human population growth considering the carrying capacity of the environment and the role of information in promoting or slowing down population growth. The model should be tested and validated using real-world scenarios and demographic data to explore its viability for investigating the link between population growth and information.   analyse the system and find the steady states solutions. Aldo using real life data find empirical values for the parameters

using Turings reaction diffusion model create a mathematical model for human population growth, where the reaction is population and the diffusion is information. When population increases then information increases then population increases. If population is approaching the carrying capacity then information increase causes slowing down of population increase

using Turings reaction diffusion model create a mathematical model for human population growth, where the reaction is population and the diffusion is information. an increase in information causes an increase in population and vice versa. when the population starts aproaching the carrying capacity the increase is slower.

To create a mathematical model using Turing’s reaction-diffusion model for human population growth with the constraints described, we can modify the interactions between the population and information variables in the previously mentioned system of PDEs.

The model should satisfy the following conditions:

1) When the population increases, information increases (positive feedback).
2) When the population is approaching the carrying capacity, increasing information slows down population growth (negative feedback).

To incorporate these conditions, we can consider the following system of PDEs:

(1) ∂P/∂t = rP(1 - P/K) + aI§(1 - P/K)
(2) ∂I/∂t = D∇²I + bP - (c + dP)I

Here:

- r is the intrinsic growth rate of the population.
- K is the carrying capacity of the environment.
- a is the feedback function representing the effect of information on population growth.
- I§ is a function of the population that captures the feedback between population and information.
- D is the diffusion coefficient of information.
- ∇² is the Laplacian operator, which measures the spatial diffusion of information.
- b is a constant representing the positive effect of population on information accumulation.
- c is a constant representing the natural decay rate of the information.
- d is a constant representing the effect of population approaching carrying capacity on information’s influence.

To satisfy the given conditions, we can define I§ such that it increases with increasing population but with diminishing effect as P approaches K. A plausible choice for I§ function is:

I§ = (1 - exp(-αP))/(1 + βP)

where α and β are constants that determine the strength and shape of the feedback.

Now we have a reaction-diffusion system that reflects the desired constraints:

(1) ∂P/∂t = rP(1 - P/K) + a((1 - exp(-αP))/(1 + βP))(1 - P/K)
(2) ∂I/∂t = D∇²I + bP - (c + dP)I

To solve this system of PDEs, appropriate initial and boundary conditions must be specified. For a real-world application, empirical data should be used to estimate the parameters r, K, a, α, β, D, b, c, and d. The model can then be solved using numerical methods, such as finite difference or finite element methods. The validity and utility of the model will depend on how well it reflects the human population growth and information dynamics in real-world scenarios, which should be tested using observed data.

To create a mathematical model using Turing’s reaction-diffusion model for human population growth satisfying the given conditions, we can modify the variables and interactions of the previous model. We will consider the following system of PDEs:

(1) ∂P/∂t = rP(1 - P/K) + aI§(1 - P/K)
(2) ∂I/∂t = D∇²I + bP - cI

Here:

- r is the intrinsic growth rate of the population.
- K is the carrying capacity of the environment.
- I§ is a function of the population that captures the feedback between population and information.
- a is a constant representing the positive effect of information on population growth.
- D is the diffusion coefficient of information.
- ∇² is the Laplacian operator, which measures the spatial diffusion of information.
- b is a constant representing the positive effect of population on information accumulation.
- c is a constant representing the natural decay rate of the information.

To satisfy the first two conditions (an increase in information causes an increase in population and vice versa), we can define I§ as a positive function of P, in this case, a simple linear relationship:

I§ = mP

where m is a constant determining the strength of the feedback.

The third condition (when the population starts approaching the carrying capacity, the increase is slower) is already captured by the logistic growth term in the first equation: rP(1 - P/K).

Now, our reaction-diffusion system representing the desired constraints is:

(1) ∂P/∂t = rP(1 - P/K) + amP(1 - P/K)
(2) ∂I/∂t = D∇²I + bP - cI

To solve this system of PDEs, appropriate initial and boundary conditions must be specified. Empirical data should be used to estimate the parameters r, K, a, m, D, b, and c for a real-world application, and the model can be solved using numerical methods like finite difference or finite element methods. - c is a constant representing the natural decay rate of the information.

To satisfy the given conditions, we can define I§ such that it increases with increasing population but has diminishing effects as P approaches K. A possible choice:

I§ = (1 - exp(-αP))/(1 + βP)

where α and β are constants that determine the strength and shape of the feedback.

With the I§ defined above, the feedback between population and information will change from positive to negative as P approaches K because the marginal effect of I§ on population growth diminishes as P increases.

Now we have a reaction-diffusion system reflecting the desired constraints:

(1) ∂P/∂t = rP(1 - P/K) + a((1 - exp(-αP))/(1 + βP))(1 - P/K)
(2) ∂I/∂t = D∇²I + bP - cI

To solve this system of PDEs, appropriate initial and boundary conditions must be specified. For a real-world application, empirical data should be used to estimate the parameters r, K, a, α, β, D, b, and c. The model can then be solved using numerical methods, such as finite difference or finite element methods.

32-bit Intel x86 architectures used a 2-level page table. They used a page size of 4 Kilobytes. The page table had a first level called a page directory, with 1024 entries. Each entry in the page directory held the address of a page table with 1024 entries. The architecture of this page table is shown below. The bottom part of the figure shows a page table entry.  
given the picture in the link 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nZHy6KQ-ilsADrYDrjg3JY8gzTFaGP87/view?usp=sharing

Suppose that the first-level page table has the following contents:

Index	Address
0	0x0
1	0x00001001
2	0x00005001
3	0x00008001
4	0x0
...	
...

1023	
0x0

A page table at address 0x5000 has the following content:

Index	Address
0	0x0
1	0x0004e001
2	0x00067001
3	0x00020001
4	0x0
...	
...

1023	
0x0

A page table at address 0x8000 has the following content:

Index	Address
0	0x00080000
1	0x00032001
2	0x00025001
3	0x0
4	0x0
...	
...

1023	
0x0

Note that an address 0x0 is used as a NULL pointer.

hi！in case you are an english teacher, plz help me to finish the quetions context based on the given context below:

the is the context:Lake Water
Where does the water in a lake come from, and how does water leave it? Water
enters a lake from inflowing rivers, from underwater seeps and springs, from overland
flow off the surrounding land, and from rain falling directly on the lake surface. Water
leaves a lake via outflowing rivers, by soaking into the bed of the lake, and by
evaporation. So much is obvious.
The questions become more complicated when actual volumes of water are
considered: how much water enters and leaves by each route? Discovering the inputs
and outputs of rivers is a matter of measuring the discharges of every inflowing and
outflowing stream and river. Then exchanges with the atmosphere are calculated by
finding the difference between the gains from rain, as measured (rather roughly) by rain
gauges, and the losses by evaporation, measured with models that correct for the other
sources of water loss. For the majority of lakes, certainly those surrounded by forests,
input from overland flow is too small to have a noticeable effect. Changes in lake level
not explained by river flows plus exchanges with the atmosphere must be due to the net
difference between what seeps into the lake from the groundwater and what leaks into
the groundwater. Note the word "net": measuring the actual amounts of groundwater
seepage into the lake and out of the lake is a much more complicated matter than merely
inferring their difference.
Once all this information has been gathered, it becomes possible to judge whether a
lake’s flow is mainly due to its surface inputs and outputs or to its underground inputs
and outputs. If the former are greater, the lake is a surface-water-dominated lake; if the
latter, it is a seepage-dominated lake. Occasionally, common sense tells you which of
these two possibilities applies. For example, a pond in hilly country that maintains a
steady water level all through a dry summer in spite of having no streams flowing into
it must obviously be seepage dominated. Conversely, a pond with a stream flowing in
one end and out the other, which dries up when the stream dries up, is clearly surface
water dominated.
By whatever means, a lake is constantly gaining water and losing water: its water
does not just sit there, or, anyway, not for long. This raises the matter of a lake’s
residence time. The residence time is the average length of time that any particular
molecule of water remains in the lake, and it is calculated by dividing the volume of
water in the lake by the rate at which water leaves the lake. The residence time is an
average; the time spent in the lake by a given molecule (if we could follow its fate) would
depend on the route it took: it might flow through as part of the fastest, most direct current,
1
or it might circle in a backwater for an indefinitely long time.
Residence times vary enormously. They range from a few days for small lakes up to
several hundred years for large ones; Lake Tahoe, in California, has a residence time of
700 years. The residence times for the Great Lakes of North America, namely, Lakes
Superior, Michigan, Huron, Erie, and Ontario, are, respectively, 190,100,22,2.5, and 6
years. Lake Erie’s is the lowest: although its area is larger than Lake Ontario’s, its volume
islessthan one-third as great because it isso shallow-less than 20 meters on average.
A given lake’s residence time is by no means a fixed quantity. It depends on the rate
at which water enters the lake, and that depends on the rainfall and the evaporation rate.
Climatic change (the result of global warming?) is dramatically affecting the residence
times of some lakes in northwestern Ontario, Canada. In the period 1970 to 1986, rainfall
in the area decreased from 1,000 millimeters to 650 millimeters per annum, while
above-average temperatures speeded up the evapotranspiration rate (the rate at which
water is lost to the atmosphere through evaporation and the processes of plant life).
The result has been that the residence time of one of the lakes increased from 5 to
18 years during the study period. The slowing down of water renewal leads to a chain of

Strong language: swearing makes you stronger, psychologists confirm.
It isn’t big and it isn’t clever. But the benefits, known to anyone who has moved home, climbed a mountain, or pushed a broken-down car, have finally been confirmed: according to psychologists, swearing makes you stronger.
The upside of letting profanities fly emerged from a series of experiments with people who repeated either a swear word or a neutral word as they pounded away on an exercise bike, or performed a simple hand-grip test.
When people cursed their way through the half-minute bike challenge, their peak power rose by 24 watts on average, according to the study. In the 10-second grip task, swearers boosted their strength by the equivalent of 2.1kg, researchers found.
"In the short period of time we looked at there are benefits from swearing," said Richard Stephens, a psychologist at Keele University, who presented the results at the British Psychological Society meeting in Brighton.
Stephens enrolled 29 people aged about 21 for the cycling test, and 52 people with a typical age of 19 for the hand-grip test. All were asked to choose a swearword to repeat in the studies, based on a term they might utter if they banged their head. For the neutral word, the volunteers were asked to pick a word they might use to describe a table, such as "wooden" or "brown".
"We asked them to repeat the word throughout each test," Stephens said. "They don’t scream and shout it. They repeat it in an even tone." The work builds on previous research by Stephens, which found evidence that expletives increased people’s tolerance to pain.
The findings may not come as a surprise to those who have let rip with profanities to spur themselves on. Stephens recalls a friend of his, Mark Foulkes, who in 2013 took part in a tandem bike ride from Reading to Barcelona to raise money for a mobile chemotherapy unit. "Swearing was a prominent feature of them powering up the Pyrenees," Stephens said.
In the latest study, people’s heart rates did not rise any more when they swore, a finding that suggests the expletives were not triggering the so-called fight-or-flight response. "Quite why it is that swearing has these effects on strength and pain tolerance remains to be discovered," Stephens said.
"We’re not telling people something they don’t already know, but we’re verifying that in a systematic and objective way," he added. "I think people instinctively reach for swearwords when they hurt themselves and when they’re looking for an extra boost in performance." I need to create an independent cost estimate for parts and repair for a  stump grinder
what parts should be considered for stump grinders

I need to create a cost estimate for parts and repair for a stump grinder, these are the  following parts should be considered:

1. Cutting Teeth: Stump grinder cutting teeth wear out over time and need to be replaced regularly.

2. Belts: The belts on the stump grinder transfer power from the engine to the cutting head. Worn or damaged belts can reduce the effectiveness of the grinder.

3. Bearings: Bearings support the rotating parts of the stump grinder, and they can wear out with regular use.

4. Hydraulic Hoses: The hydraulic system on a stump grinder powers the cutting head and moves the grinder from place to place. Leaking or damaged hydraulic hoses can reduce the effectiveness of the grinder.

5. Engines: The engine is the heart of the stump grinder, and it needs to be replaced if it is damaged or worn out.

6. Filters: Stump grinder filters help keep the engine and hydraulic system clean and prevent damage to the engine and other components.

7. Grease and Oil: Regularly changing the grease and oil on the stump grinder can help prevent damage to the engine and other components.

8. Other Components: Other components of the stump grinder that may need replacement or repair include the wheels, axles, frame, and cutting head.  I need to find the national average cost per part

import google.auth
from google.oauth2.credentials import Credentials
from googleapiclient.discovery import build
from googleapiclient.errors import HttpError
from googleapiclient.http import MediaFileUpload

def authenticate_youtube():
credentials = None
# The file token.json stores the user’s access and refresh tokens, and is
# created automatically when the authorization flow completes for the first
# time.
if os.path.exists(‘token.json’):
credentials = Credentials.from_authorized_user_file(‘token.json’, [‘https://www.googleapis.com/auth/youtube.upload’])
# If there are no (valid) credentials available, let the user log in.
if not credentials or not credentials.valid:
if credentials and credentials.expired and credentials.refresh_token:
credentials.refresh(Request())
else:
flow = InstalledAppFlow.from_client_secrets_file(
‘client_secret.json’, [‘https://www.googleapis.com/auth/youtube.upload’])
credentials = flow.run_local_server(port=8080)
# Save the credentials for the next run
with open(‘token.json’, ‘w’) as token:
token.write(credentials.to_json())
return credentials

def upload_video(file, title, description, privacy):
credentials = authenticate_youtube()
youtube = build(‘youtube’, ‘v3’, credentials=credentials)

# File details
file_name = input("type in the file path from here or the url: ")
file_size = os.path.getsize(file)
file_type = ‘video/mp4’

# Upload video
try:
body = dict(
	snippet=dict(
		title=title,
		description=description,
		tags=[‘youtube’, ‘api’, ‘python’]
	),
	status=dict(
	privacyStatus=privacy
	)
)

video = MediaFileUpload(file_name, resumable=True, chunksize=256*1024)
insert_request = youtube.videos().insert(part=‘,’.join(body.keys()), body=body, media_body=video)
response = None
while response is None:
status, response = insert_request.next_chunk()
if status:
print(f"\rUploading {int(status.progress() * 100)}%“)
print(f”\nVideo {response[‘id’]} was successfully uploaded.“)
return response[‘id’], file_name, file_size
except HttpError as e:
print(f”\nAn error occurred: {e}")
return None

Mother decides that John will also be picking out a swimsuit from Victoria’s Secret for himself even though they only sell women’s bathing suits. I’ll start with a really weird one I had. It started with me visiting a friend of mines who I hadn’t seen a long time because we both moved to different countries. I was driving him to his house, and while driving down the road I noticed the house of another friend of mine who had also moved away, except it wasn’t his real house it was the house he lived in in another dream of mine. Are you following me?

Hold on, the dream isn’t even close to being done yet. So, I get my friend to his house. Let’s call him C. So C and I walk in. It’s on a large patch of land on a hill in Ecuador. He leads me into this relatively normal house, except it’s really packed with stuff and I think there were a lot of plants growing in it, I don’t fully remember. Also, I should point out that he always lived in a really big house, so it was strange for him to be living in a regular (albeit packed) one. While in this house, my friend said hello to one of his friends, who happened to be one of my friends. Let’s call this friend L. L and C, in reality, don’t know each other. I was confused, since L and C had always lived in different countries, so they should not know each other. C was surprised when I greeted L by name, and asked how we knew each other. I said that L and I were teammates, which is true. I then asked how L and C knew each other. L simply said that he went down to Utah. Do you have everything so far?

I point out that C’s house is smaller thank his old one and he tells me that this isn’t his house, he only lives there. So C goes to show me his house. We step outside and he points to a massive 4 story building. It was a large rectangular prism, and seriously huge. Also, it looked to be built similar to homes in the Middle East out of clay, and was extremely basic. Literally just a huge rectangular prism with windows. Also, it had a pointed roof with a window that allowed me to see that it had a finished attic, just like his old house did in real life. I was amazed, because this house was insane. One floor was probably the size of a regular house. He then pointed out in the distance a very similar looking house, albeit made with bricks and just overall fancier. He told me it was his school, and I said that it must suck being so close to school. He said it was fine. You have everything so far?

C then shows me around his garden, which has some extravagant fountains and pools and is manicured perfectly and on multiple levels. Also, there were other people walking around this place, like it was a party. I know more happened to lead to the next scene, but I don’t really remember it. The next thing I remember is being in the first floor of the house, which was a massive fancy ballroom. Strangely, it had a tent roof, like a circus tent. I was wearing a tux or suit or something fancy, and there were a bunch of other people around me also dressed formally. I turned to another guy (I’m not sure who, but I know him in real life. He was a friend of mine.) and said it was crazy that he had a whole ballroom in his house. The guy agreed, but strangely nobody thought it weird that he had a whole ballroom in his house. The next thing I remember, everybody is playing some strange D&D themed tag, and I’m running around the ballroom trying not to get tagged. Because of some weird thing I can say thunderbolt to stop someone from tagging me, so it takes a long time for me to get caught. Are you following?

Hold on, because things get a little more sinister in a little while. The next thing I remember, C is showing me around his house. He shows me his bedroom, which is furnished sparsely. In his bed is a girl, pretty, I think about our age. I don’t know her in real life. In real life, C recently got a girlfriend, so I assumed it was her. The next thing I remember, we’re in front of a pool in front of the house. The pool is on a stone tile floor and lit up. It’s really nice. The girl is in the pool treading water, looking at me as if she’s fascinated by me. She had bangs, nice blonde hair, and strangely clear skin. Anyways, C asked me to get in the pool and he jumped in. He all of a sudden had a swimsuit on and I still had my suit or tux or whatever. Are you following? There’s just a little bit more.

I grab my phone and try to text my mom to tell her that I’d be staying here for a while and would be home late. When I opened the text messages she had told me that she would be starting a new job. I don’t remember where. I tried to tell her to go for it, but when I sent the message my phone changed it to be mean. I tried to send more messages to fix it but every message was changed to be malicious. After sending a few messages (I knew that something really weird was going on) I jumped into the pool. Opening my eyes underwater I noticed that I could see really clearly and my eyes didn’t hurt at all, even though I was underwater. I surfaced and swam to another, shallower, area and dipped underwater again and struggled to see at all. I figured it was the lighting. That’s all of the dream I remember. Did you get all that? Feel free to ask questions.

Wait, there are a few details I think are critical. I think the feelings I got are the most important part of this dream. First off, I felt that the house itself was evil. Not haunted or anything but just as itself was evil. During the dream I was pretty confused, a little nostalgic due to seeing old friends, and pretty in awe of the house, especially the ballroom. C always made me feel a little uneasy in real life, and that was magnified during this dream. He had some issues that really affected my perception of him, but was for the most part pretty normal and a nice guy to be around. I didn’t feel scared of him, because I believed I could defend myself against him, but I was definitely uneasy. I thought he was acting strange the whole time, and when L and C saw each other I thought it really strange, especially since L’s explanation for meeting C was extremely vague and highly improbable. So overall, I was extremely uneasy throughout but still calm. Also, I was never really scared at all. Also, I thought that everyone was acting strangely. They should have been more impressed by the crazy house, but no one really cared and mostly ignored me when I expressed my amazement. While I was down by the pool I felt as if everyone around me was being mind-controlled or influenced. They seemed to be swept up in desire, as if they were acting solely on whatever whim they felt. There was no evidence of this, just a general feeling. Upon waking from the dream I felt weird about two people, both of which were not in my dream. One of them was a girl that I am interested in in real life. I just felt overall worried about her. Another was a girl I know from school. I don’t remember her from my dream but she was likely there, since I think about her sometimes because she’s really hot. I just felt weird about her, and when I saw her in school she looked at me as if she thought I was hot too. Also, this dream was very vivid, especially visually. It looked pretty much just like real life, although not quite as real, and there were no strange visual features that would have made it obvious that this was a dream. Any more questions or are you ready to interpret?
Could you try to delve a little deeper on possible explanations of my feelings about the two girls, especially the hot one?

describe a man in police custody in the UK being locked in a cell for the first time, include the moment the door closes and how that feels and the reality of the situation compared to what he had wondered about
describe a custody cell in the UK
re tell your story about martin changing the details to that of a UK cell, change martins name to Fraser

describe Fraser being bored in the cell, his feeling of being trapped, he cannot believe he ever thought he wanted to know what this experience was like, he paces around the confined room and finds himself stopping in front of the door, he instinctively pushes against it and it of course doesn't move in the slightest reminding him how he is completely locked in.

fellow up, note that he is not cuffed in the cell. He manages to fall asleep and wakens back up to his stark reality. He asks the officer on the intercom if there is anything to read and is told there are no books at that custody suite, he sits back down on the thin blue mattress and struggles to get back to sleep, there is absolutely nothing to do, he has a slight chuckle to himself about how he didn't get grounded often as a teen and now he was trapped with no entertainment. Overcome with frustration he begins pacing again, he pushes on the door with all his might but it is perfectly impassible, he remains trapped and sits back down defeated.

he asks on the intercom what time it is and when he might be released, it is 5 am on sunday morning, as he has been arrested on a saturday night he is told he will be held until monday morning. Frasers heart sinks at this grim news, more than 24 more hours trapped with absolutely nothing to do, utterly defeated and regretful he lays back down and closes his eyes resigned to his fate and manages to drift off to a troubled sleep

Fraser wakes up again, he is told it is just after 12 PM after requesting something to eat and drink boredom settles back in as he realises it will be many hours until he is tired enough to sleep again, all he can do is pace the cell once more in a futile attempt to escape the oppressive tedium. He stares at the locked unyielding door that is keeping him prisoner and thinks once again about how he once wanted to know what this experience felt like, he has gotten what he wished for and then some.

It is finally Monday morning, an officer comes to the cell, Fraser feels a rush at seeing the door finally open, the officer has one last unwelcome surprise however, he informs Fraser he is being issued with a Penalty Notice for Disorder due to being  Drunk & disorderly on Saturday night. All the hours of boredom in the cell and he must now pay £90, an expensive weekend. He puts the penalty notice handed to him in his coat pocket and leaves the station curiosity about police custody more than satisfied.

- Conduct user testing and incorporate feedback into the final version of the website.
- Develop and implement a security plan to protect the website and users’ data.

- Ensure tracking and analysis tools are properly installed to measure website performance and user behavior.
- Monitor website performance and make any necessary improvements or updates.

How is the hydrogen in heavy water different from the hydrogen in normal water?





The hydrogen in heavy water is radioactive.



The hydrogen atoms in heavy water have one neutron in the nucleus, doubling the mass.

Please describe the following text in triples: "Once upon a time, in a land far, far away there was a brave knight named Sir Robert. Sir Robert had a quest to rescue the princess from the dragon’s lair. He set out on his trusty horse and fought the dragon with all his might. After a fierce battle, Sir Robert emerged victorious and rescued the princess. The kingdom rejoiced and Sir Robert was hailed a hero.".
Can you describe these triplets so that the order of events is not ambiguous.
Can you break the triplets further down into finer details, more accurately describing the sentences?
Also, list definitions of the different concepts in the story in triplet form.
Break down some of the more complex definitions (for example "a courageous and chivalrous warrior") in separate triplets.
Several of these definitions are too complex and should be split up into separate triplets.
Definitions like "burning gases emitting heat and light" are too complex. Such definitions should be put into two or three triplets.

Instead of "(brave knight, definition, a courageous and chivalrous warrior)", do it something like this: "(brave knight, definition, warrior); (brave knight, definition, courageous); (brave knight, definition, chivalrous)".
The "definition" part in the triplets seems unnecessary. For example, "(courageous, definition, possessing bravery)" could be reformulated as "(courageous, possess, bravery)".
what's the difference between "is" and "is a" as a relation in the triplets?

Hermanubis
Hermanubis is a God who combines aspects of the Hellenic deity Hermes with Kemetic deity Anubis. Hermes and Anubis’s similar responsibilities (both being conductor of the soul, or psychopomps, who lead souls to the afterlife) led to the discovery of Hermanubis, who acted as an assimilation of Anubis into the Hellenic pantheon. Hermanubis represents the Egyptian priesthood, engaged in the investigation of truth. He is the son of the deities Isis and Serapis. The worship of Hermanubis was popular during the Roman era of Egypt.
Plutarch cites the name as a designation of Anubis in his underworldly aspect, while Porphyry refers to Hermanubis as “σύνθετος,” meaning “composite” and “μιξέλλην,” meaning “half-Greek.”
Iconography
Hermanubis is typically depicted as having a human body and jackal head, with the sacred caduceus. Sometimes a solar disk is depicted on His head. At times He is also depicted wearing a soldiers armour, but more common are priestly garbs.
Bibliography
Porphyry, De imaginibus fr. 8, p. 18. 1–2 Bidez

HELLENIC FAITH Hellenic Faith is a website dedicated to Julian Hellenism, a reformed denomination of Hellenism, the polytheistic religion of the Graeco-Roman world, influenced by the teachings and writings of Julian the Philosopher (r. 361-363 ACE) and the divine Iamblichus (c. 245-325 ACE). It is a Orphic-Platonic tradition, derived from the teachings of Orpheus through the Platonic school, and solar-based, centered around the worship of the omnipotent creator God, King Zeus-Helios.
This website is under constant construction. It is expected to be completed by (at the very least) the year 2021 ACE. Everything on this website is subject to change. Many articles are incomplete, and those which do seem complete may be subject to complete revision.

I need you to act as a professional English paper teacher, Please help me to improve my expression in the style of the journal Biomedical Optics Express. Here is my expression.
Organ development analysis is very important for the assessment of individual growth health. In this paper, we presented a method for quantitative characterization of multiple organs of zebrafish during their growth using non-invasive Mueller matrix optical coherence tomography (Mueller matrix OCT) combined with deep learning. Firstly, Mueller matrix OCT was employed to obtain 3D images during the development of zebrafish. The deep learning U-net network was applied to segment the body, eyes, spine, yolk sac and swim bladder of zebrafish. Then the volume of each organ of zebrafish were calculated after segmentation. Finally, the development and proportion trend of zebrafish embryos and organs from 1 to 19 days were quantitatively analyzed. Various quantitative results demonstrated that the volume development of fish body and various organs showed a steady growth trend. Small organs such as spine and swim bladder were also successfully quantified during the growth process. The results indicate that Muller matrix OCT combined with deep learning can effectively quantify the development of various organs during the development from zebrafish embryos. This will provide a more intuitive and effective monitoring method for clinical medicine and developmental biology.

I need you to act as a professional English paper teacher, please help me to improve my expression in the style of the journal Biomedical Optics Express. Here is my expression.
The factors that affect the growth of humans and animals during the growth and development are various. Embryonic development may have different developmental states at the same period due to many factors, such as insufficient nutrition, poor living conditions or heredity [1]. In severe cases, it can cause problems such as developmental delays, developmental deformity, and even multiple organ failure[2]. Therefore, the diagnosis of early embryonic development is an important issue for human and animal development.
In recent decades, zebrafish has been widely used in the research of organ development and embryo development due to its advantages of small size, transparent embryo, easy observation of in vitro fertilization and strong reproductive ability [3]. In addition, zebrafish share up to 70% homology with human genes[4], making it a powerful experimental model for studying developmental biology, embryogenesis, pathology and developmental regeneration [5, 6]. Riddle et al. summarized the zebrafish model used to study the effects of nutrition on embryonic structural development, and pointed out that zebrafish is one of the most valuable and powerful species for studying developmental nutrition control [7]. Han et al. employed zebrafish to investigate the importance of precise doses of folic acid supplementation on embryonic and heart development in zebrafish. The results showed that insufficient or excessive folic acid in zebrafish embryos could lead to ventricular pericardial edema or abnormal cardiac circulation and other developmental abnormalities[8]. Huang et al. pointed out that the advantages of zebrafish in the study of craniofacial bone development is due to its simple craniofacial structure [9]. In vitro fertilization and transparent embryos, facial morphogenesis is easy to observe, making it a valuable platform for screening and identifying environmental factors related to the etiology of craniofacial skeletal malformations[9]. Qian et al pointed out that phthalates can cause spinal defects in zebrafish embryos[10]. The above studies indicate that zebrafish is widely used in environmental effects or nutritional intake affecting embryonic development. It means that both internal and external factors can cause organ malformations. Therefore, it is necessary to further confirm the structure of each organ accurately so as to diagnose the organs with abnormal development in the study of organ malformations in embryo and larva development. To provide more accurate diagnosis of organ development, precise segmentation of organs during development is needed. This will reveal crucial information such as shape and volume of different organs during the development[11, 12].

I need you to act as a professional English paper teacher, please help me to improve my expression in the style of the journal Biomedical Optics Express. Here is my expression:
Currently, a variety of imaging techniques have been used for image segmentation, such as computed tomography (CT) [13], positron emission tomography (PET) [14], confocal microscopy[15] , and fluorescence microscopy [16]. CT involves high doses of harmful radiation. PET is widely used in clinic due to its high sensitivity and specificity in tissues, but its spatial resolution and accuracy are low. PET imaging also requires contrast agent, which makes it difficult to diagnose many diseases [11, 12, 17, 18]. Although confocal microscopy has the advantage of higher resolution, its shallow imaging depth limits the imaging range of zebrafish in late development. Therefore, confocal microscopy is not suitable for monitoring the development of zebrafish. In addition, although fluorescence microscopy can capture dynamic samples in vivo, the sample mold requires a fluorescent dye[19]. So, it is necessary to have a detection system with in situ, no label, high resolution, high sensitivity, and large detection range to ensure the accuracy of image segmentation and data analysis. The above requirements can be well achieved by Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT).

I need you to act as a professional English paper teacher, please help me to improve my expression in the style of the journal Biomedical Optics Express. Here is my expression:
OCT is a biomedical imaging technology for subsurface imaging of tissue samples with high image resolution of less than ten micrometers and a penetration depth of several millimeters[20].OCT is based on the optical scattering properties of tissues that have a certain contrast with biological structure and phase information [21]. Nowadays, OCT has been widely employed in biomedical research with its high speed imaging, high signal-to-noise ratio, and non-invasiveness. OCT imaging is similar to ultrasound B-mode imaging, except that it measures the echo delay and intensity of backscattered light rather than sound[22, 23]. In OCT, the optical beam is scanned across the tissue and the backscattered light is measured as a function of axial depth and transverse location. In this way, OCT can generate cross-sectional, tomographic images of surface tissue microstructures and obtain 3D tissue morphology by stacking a series of 2D OCT tomography imagings [24]. As a functional branch of OCT, Mueller matrix OCT can not only measure the light intensity information of samples, but also reflect the polarization and refractive index information of samples[25]. Therefore, Mueller matrix OCT can provide more information about the sample by acquiring the characteristics of the polarized light.
In this study, Mueller matrix OCT combined deep learning was employed to quantitatively analyze multiple organs of zebrafish development process. The zebrafish images from 1-day post-fertilization (dpf) to 19dpf developmental process were obtained by Mueller matrix OCT. Then, deep learning was applied to automatically segment zebrafish organ, such as embryos, eyes, yolk sac, and swim bladder. The volume of each organ was then calculated and its development trend was obtained in 19 days. Finally, the proportion of organs during the development of zebrafish was quantified. Results show that the development of the spine and swim bladder of zebrafish is relatively slower than other organs, but the overall trend is still growth. Results indicate that the method can accurately observe the development of various organs during the growth of zebrafish. And it provide a more convenient and rapid means for the analysis of growth morphology of zebrafish. The method can also be used as an auxiliary means to monitor the anomalies  during the growth of zebrafish.

I need you to act as a professional English paper teacher, please help me to improve my expression in the style of the journal Biomedical Optics Express. Here is my expression:
1. Preparation and culture of zebrafish
The animal protocol in this study has been approved by the committee on animal care and use at Fujian Normal University. Wild-type zebrafish provided from the zebrafish Resource Center in our study. The temperature of the laboratory rearing tank is maintained at 28.5±1℃, and the hydrogen potential (PH) is 7.0±0.2. The zebrafish live in an environment with 14 hours of light and 10 hours of darkness a day, and are guaranteed to change the water and feed the shrimp twice a day, at 10 a.m. and 3 p.m.[26]. Four embryonic  development of zebrafish were observed by Mueller matrix OCT, starting from the first day after fertilization and lasting for 19 days. Before image collection, zebrafish were anesthetized with 10μl MS-222 with 15ml water. After collection, the zebrafish used in the experiment were placed in clean water to wake up and continue to breed.

I need you to act as a professional English paper teacher, please help me to improve my expression in the style of the journal Biomedical Optics Express. Here is my expression:
2.2 Mueller matrix optical coherence tomography
A home-made spectral domain Mueller matrix OCT system employed in this study has been described in our previous work [25]. The axial and lateral resolutions of the system in air are 8.9 µm and 18.2 µm, respectively. A polarization state generator (PSG, PG-001-13-FA /APC, Beijing Optical Application Co., LTD.) was applied to control the polarization state of the incident light in our Mueller matrix OCT system. Compared with conventional OCT, our system saves the time of manually adjusting the wave plate during deflection, resulting in more precise polarization states. In addition, the system uses two spectrometers to detect polarized light at the same time, which improves the data acquisition speed.
2.3 Zebrafish data acquisition
Polarization-difference-balanced-detection images of zebrafish were obtained based on Mueller matrix OCT. Mueller matrix OCT was used to collect 400 cross-sectional images of each zebrafish, which contained valid zebrafish structure and invalid environmental data. Four different polarization state images can be obtained for each image,depending on the vertical and horizontal incidence polarization states and the detected polarization state conditions. The four polarization state images can be labeled as ShDh , ShDv, SvDh, and SvDv, where S and D represent the sample and the detection arm, respectively, and subscripts h and v are horizontal and vertical line polarized light. The four elements of the Muller matrix M can be calculated from the four determined OCT images of polarization state.

I need you to act as a professional English paper teacher, please help me to improve my expression in the style of the journal Biomedical Optics Express. Here is my expression:
Fig. 1 shows an image of the four elements of the Muller matrix. In order to more accurately analyze the size and volume of zebrafish organs, the axial and lateral resolutions of Mueller matrix OCT images were adjusted to the same size. Because organ segmentation requires more image detail. For the organ boundaries of juvenile zebrafish, the amount of detail in the image is determined by comparing the region of interest (ROI) inside and outside the organ boundary. If the proportion of ROI regions at the inner and outer boundaries is close to 1, the boundary difference between the two regions is small. This means the image contains less information. It has been confirmed that the embryonic boundary of M11 image is clearer than that of M00 image in our previous study[27]. Therefore, M11 image was used to segment the embryos. For the smaller organ of juvenile zebrafish, eye was taken as an example to analyze which polarization state image contains more detail information, as shown in Fig. 2. In Fig. 2(a), the inner and outer boundaries of the eye M00 image ROI region are labeled as ROI-I and ROI-II. Pro-M00 represents the area ratio of the inner and outer boundaries of M00 ROI region, expressed as Pro〖-M〗_00=(ROI-Ⅰ)/(ROI-Ⅱ). Similarly, Pro-M11 represents the area ratio of M11, expressed as Pro〖-M〗_11=(ROI -Ⅲ)/(ROI -Ⅳ), as shown in Fig. 2(b). The average ratio results are shown in Fig. 2(c), where the Pro-M00 is 0.5233, and the Pro-M11 is 0.6726. It indicates that the boundary distinction of the smaller organs in the M00 image contains more details than that in the M11 image. Therefore, M00 is used for multi-organ segmentation of juvenile zebrafish.

1.5 Multi-classification volume of zebrafish quantification
1.5.1 Quantification of embryonic volume in zebrafish
Zebrafish embryo segmentation process is displayed in Fig. 4. Firstly, the zebrafish embryos data from 1dpf to 3dpf were collected by Mueller matrix OCT at this stage. Then, M11 images as shown in Fig. 4(a) were taken to segment the outline of zebrafish embryo and the structure of the yolk sac. The segmented data was then extracted to reconstruct a 3D image as illustrated in Fig. 4(b). Then, the embryonic outline of the zebrafish and the yolk sac were segmented, as shown in Fig. 4(c) and (d). Finally, the contour volumes of embryo and yolk sac were calculated respectively. The specific calculation method is to calculate the total pixel of embryo and yolk sac in each M11 data respectively. Then, each pixel was taken as a separate volume pixel. The actual area of the x-z plane was obtained by multiplying with the axial resolution by lateral resolution based on Mueller matrix OCT. The actual volume of zebrafish embryo segmentation data was calculated by multiplying the area of the x-z plane by the distance between images in the y direction.

1.5.2 Quantification of multi-organs volume in zebrafish
The organs of zebrafish are gradually complete as the zebrafish emerging from the embryo. This stage starts on the fourth day, ends on the nineteen day. Fig. 5 (a) shows the cross-section of zebrafish collected by Mueller matrix OCT at this stage. About 100 valid data (excluding invalid data) were collected to calculate the zebrafish organ volume in each zebrafish. Zebrafish was placed on the sample arm of Mueller matrix OCT in a lying position to ensure the uniform position during the collection process, as shown in Fig. 5 (b). OCT collects data from the x-z direction. The advantage of Mueller matrix OCT is that it can observe a more complete structure of zebrafish compared with the x-y microscopic acquisition (Fig.5 (c)). Fig. 5 (b) shows the 3D reconstruction of a group of zebrafish. In Fig. 5 (b), 3D organs, such as the eyes, spine, and yolk sac can be clearly observed.
Organ volume was used as a quantitative parameter to analyze the growth trend of zebrafish. The detailed calculation method of organ volume is as follows: Firstly, the effective pixels of each B-scanned image was calculated, and then the total number of effective pixels of a group of B-scanned images was added to get the total number of pixels occupied by a complete group of zebrafish. Then each pixel was considered as a cube. The actual volume could be calculated by volume=TP*LAR*LOR*D,where TP is the total number of pixels of zebrafish, LAR and LOR is the actual lateral resolution and longitudinal resolution by Mueller matrix OCT system, D is the actual distance between each image. 
1.6 Multi-classification proportion of zebrafish organs quantification method
In order to further analyze the development process of zebrafish, the proportion of organs were calculated to for quantitative analysis the zebrafish development progress. For 1dpf-3dpf zebrafish embryos, the proportion of yolk sac volume to embryo outline volume by Mueller matrix OCT and the proportion of yolk sac area to embryo outline area by microscope were calculated, respectively. The proportion expression is P_OCT=V_(O-yolk)/V_(O-out)  and P_micro=S_(m-yolk)/S_(m-out)  ,where POCT and Pmicro is the volume proportion and the area volume proportion between yolk and embryo outline by Mueller matrix OCT and microscope, respectively. Where V_(O-yolk),S_(m-yolk),V_(O-out)  and S_(m-out) are the volume of yolk sac and embryo outline by Mueller matrix OCT and microscope, respectively. For the juvenile zebrafish (4dpf-19dpf), the proportion eyes, spine, and yolk sac to the zebrafish’s body during 16 days were calculated by  P_1=V_eye/V_body   ,P_2=V_spine/V_body   ,P_3=V_yolk/V_body   and P_4=V_swim/V_body  respectively.
2.7 Data analysis
Data are expressed as mean ± standard deviation. A two-sample t-test with unequal means was completed to determine whether the difference was significant in the statistical parameters between any two sample groups. Differences were regarded as statistically significant when p<0.05.

1.1 Multi-classification of zebrafish organs using deep learning
Deep learning was employed to segment the organs of zebrafish in order to more clearly showdisplay and analyze the changes of organs structure during development process. 3,782 zebrafish data in 19 days were collected from Mueller matrix OCT, with a total of 41 valid data sets. Among them, 350 data sets were selected for manual label (as shown in Fig. 3), and these data sets were randomly divided into training data sets (90%) and validation data sets (10%) to improve the robustness of the model. Then, the remaining images (un-label) were taken as a prediction sets. U-net network was takeselectedn as the main trunk network, and resnet50 was chosen as the backbone feature extraction network [28]. Batch size was set to 8 and the number of iterations to 300 according to our experimental environment. In addition, Adam optimizer was applied to optimize the model[29]. The learning rate was initially set to 0.0001 and the decay rate to 0.9995. Mean pixel accuracy (MPA) was applied to evaluate the accuracy of classify. The formula for MPA is as follows[30]:
where C is the number of classes in the segmentation results, Pi is pixel accuracy for class i. The proportion of correct classification in the segmentation result was calculated by MPA, and then the average of this proportion is taken across all classes. The higher the MPA, the more accurate the segmentation result.

summarise this: The personal name Ἑρμάνουβιϲ and related forms are usually subsumed under the category of "polytheophoric" names characteristic of Roman Egypt. These are names that combine the names of two deities, such as Ἡρακλαπόλλων or Ἑρμαντίνοοϲ. They are attested solely in the Roman period, especially between the second and the fourth centuries, and were predominantly popular among males of the middle and upper classes in certain metropoleis like Hermopolis.[1] The name Ἑρμάνουβιϲ, however, though formally combining two divine names, is somewhat special: unlike other polytheophoric names, it refers to a specific deity that is independently attested in Roman Egypt. In other words, it is the name of the god himself that is a "polytheophoric" formation, and this has some consequences on how the personal names based on this deity are formed. Before discussing these names, it is appropriate first to give a brief summary of our state of knowledge about Hermanubis. After reviewing the name forms based on this deity, the onomastic evidence will be related and compared to his iconographical and documentary attestations.

summarise this: The divine name Ἑρμάνουβιϲ is known from a handful of epigraphic and literary sources, mostly of the Roman period.[2] Plutarch cites the name as a designation of Anubis in his underworldly aspect (De Is. et Os. 375e), while Porphyry refers to Hermanubis as ϲύνθετοϲ, "composite," and μιξέλλην, "half-Greek" (De imaginibus fr. 8, p. 18.1–2 Bidez). The name has been restored in a second-century BC dedicatory inscription from Delos (ID 2156.2 [Ἑρ]μανού[βιδι νικ]ηφόρωι), which would be its earliest attestation, but otherwise it appears in three inscriptions of the Roman period, two from Egypt and one from Thessalonike (see below). It is clear that the name is a result of the assimilation of the Egyptian god Anubis to the Greek god Hermes, which is well attested in a number of literary, epigraphic, and artistic sources.[3] Although Hermes was traditionally equated with the Egyptian Thoth, his function as psychopompos encouraged his association with Anubis given the latter's comparable funerary role in Egyptian religion as embalmer and guardian of the dead and as leader of the deceased to the tribunal of Osiris. This assimilation resulted in widespread Graeco-Roman representations of the canine-headed Anubis with attributes of the Greek Hermes, such as the distinctive staff known as the kerykeion or winged sandals.[4] As far as I know, none of these representations whose provenance is known was found in Egypt, though this may be due to mere chance.[5] But in Roman Alexandria there emerges a new iconographical type, well represented in coins and sculpture, in which a fully anthropomorphic young god is flanked by a dog and holds the same attributes as the said Anubis, in addition to wearing the calathos headdress.[6] It is this type that art historians have traditionally labeled "Hermanubis." In making this identification, they have been encouraged by Porphyry's statement about the god's "composite" and "half-Hellenic" character. However, it is important to stress that the reference to the fully anthropomorphic type as "Hermanubis" is only a hypothetical convention, and that not a single of the numerous representations of this type bears a legend or inscription identifying it as such.[7] I will return to this question at the end of the paper in light of the onomastic evidence.

summarise this: There are three forms of the personal name based on Hermanubis in papyri and inscriptions from Egypt, in addition to two "proper" polytheophoric names. (In four instances [1, 5, 17, 21] the ending of the name is abbreviated or not preserved.) The form Ἑρμάνουβιϲ, attested six times (2, 9, 11, 13, 14, 15), simply replicates the god's name without further ado, through the phenomenon of "direct theonymy" (the giving to humans of unaltered divine names) that became widespread in the Roman period.[8] In an odd instance (9) the form Ἑρμανουβιϲ in the nominative is borne by a woman, an Alexandrian nurse (ἡ τροφόϲ).[9] It is highly unusual for female theophoric names to be unmarked for gender in this way.[10] I suspect that because the element -ανουβιϲ in Ἑρμάνουβιϲ was often declined with a dental declension in -ιδ-, it might have been conflated with the similar declension of Greek feminine names in -ίϲ, -ίδοϲ.[11] If this is correct, it may be preferable to read the nurse's name as an oxytone (Ἑρμανουβίϲ). There are two further forms based on the god Hermanubis: Ἑρμανουβᾶϲ (six instances: 3, 4, 7, 8, 12, 20) and Ἑρμανουβίων (four instances: 3, 6, 18, 19). -ᾶϲ and -ίων were, in fact, the commonest Greek suffixes for personal names based on the Egyptian god Ἄνουβιϲ.[12] It is interesting that in a business letter (3) the two forms Ἑρμανουβίων (l.38) and Ἑρμανουβᾶϲ (l.41) are used interchangeably to designate the same individual. In this case, Ἑρμανουβᾶϲ is probably a hypocoristic of Ἑρμανουβίων, since the suffix -ᾶϲ often served this purpose.[13]

summarise this: These forms of the name Ἑρμάνουβιϲ with modified suffixes already separate names based on Hermanubis from other polytheophoric names, which usually simply join two divine names without modifying the original suffix.[14] Indeed, because Hermanubis was conceptualized as a single god, it is not surprising to find personal names such as Ἑρμανοβάμμων (16) and Ἡρακλερμάνουβιϲ (10), in which the name of Hermanubis is joined to that of other gods in the characteristic pattern of polytheophoric names. It is misleading to analyze these names as triple theophoric names, for they imply the juxtaposition of only two gods, Hermanubis and Ammon in one, and Hermanubis and Heracles in the other.[15] In this respect, they are not exceptions to the rule that polytheophoric names combine no more than two deities.

summarise this: The near majority of the names based on Hermanubis are attested in papyri of the second and third centuries AD. Possibly the earliest example is on an ostracon dated to AD 94 (1), but the name there is abbreviated and Ἑρμανο(υβίου) is Wilcken's resolution.[16] Otherwise, the next attestations are from the second quarter of the second century. There are overall eight instances from the second century, eight from the third, and three from the fourth. One instance is from an inscription dated broadly to the "imperial period." The name disappears from the evidence after the fourth century. What is notable about this chronological distribution is that it corresponds neatly to that of the iconographical representations of the fully anthropomorphic god known conventionally as "Hermanubis." For example, the great number of Alexandrian coins that show a representation of this type on the reverse range from the reign of Trajan (or possibly as early as Domitian) to the Tetrarchic period. Likewise, the statues, statuettes, and carved reliefs of this god have all been assigned to the second or third century AD.[17]

summarise this: Geographically, names based on Hermanubis are attested in papyri from various areas of Egypt, but it is important to separate, where possible, the provenance of the papyrus from that of the individuals named therein. When this is done, most of the individuals bearing Hermanubis names for whom we can establish an origin turn out to be Alexandrian or Cynopolite (three instances each). This concentration again coincides with the documentary and archaeological evidence for the god Hermanubis. Thus, in the precinct of the Alexandrian Serapeum an inscription of uncertain date was found (SB I 3482) dedicated to "Hermanubis, great god, who listens to prayers and grants favours" (Ἑρμανούβιδι θεῶι μεγάλωι | ἐπηκόωι καὶ εὐχαρίϲτωι).[18] Not far from this dedication a statuette of the anthropomorphic "Hermanubis" was discovered.[19] It is in a suburb of Alexandria, in the sanctuary of Ras el-Soda, that the most famous statue of "Hermanubis" was found (LIMC n. 14). One of the Alexandrian coins representing the god shows him standing inside a temple (LIMC nos. 5a, b), which suggests the existence of such an edifice in the city, probably in the Serapeum precinct given the provenance of the just-mentioned dedication and statuette from there and the frequent iconographical associations between "Hermanubis" and Sarapis in Alexandrian coins.[20] Alexandria, then, clearly emerges as the cult center and probably the birthplace of the fully anthropomorphic Hermanubis, which is consonant with the three Alexandrians bearing his name (5, 6, 9).[21] For the Cynopolite nome, the chief centre of the Egyptian god Anubis, the onomastic evidence is more suggestive than the archaeological and the iconographical. Among the three individuals with a name based on Hermanubis (11, 15, 16), there stands out the father of an underage priest of "Anubis, Leto and associated gods" in the Cynopolite village of Laura (15). Since priesthood was usually hereditary, the father Hermanubis was probably himself a priest of these gods. This onomastic connection of Hermanubis with the Cynopolite nome also has an echo in the iconography: one or two Alexandrian coins personify the Cynopolite nome with a representation of the anthropomorphic "Hermanubis" on their reverse (LIMC nos. 3, 22).

summarise this: Three conclusions flow from this onomastic survey. First, names based on Hermanubis stand somewhat apart from other polytheophoric names common in the same period in Roman Egypt because, unlike the latter, they refer to a specific and independently attested god: a hybrid-named Hellenized version of Anubis. This is visible in the "onomastic behaviour" of Hermanubis names, such as their receptivity to various suffixes and their composition with names of other gods in "proper" polytheophoric formations. Second, the precise chronological and geographical overlap between the onomastic evidence and the representations of the fully anthropomorphic Alexandrian god known conventionally as "Hermanubis" supports art historians' designation of the latter as "Hermanubis" (for which there is otherwise no positive support; see above). Finally, the connection of Hermanubis with Cynopolis evidenced by some of the personal names, and especially the connection with a priest of Anubis, suggests that Hermanubis continued to be closely associated with the traditional Anubis. It may not be warranted, therefore, to separate too forcefully, in the manner of Jean-Claude Grenier (1990: 265, 268), the more traditional funerary Anubis of the Isiac cult from a more "universalizing" Hermanubis.[22]

summarise this: I conclude by noting that a name based on Hermanubis is attested once outside Egypt in an inscription from Dion in Macedonia dated to the imperial period (22). The form of the name there is Ἑρμα-νούβιοϲ, which is not known from Egypt. The name is probably to be related to the cult of Hermanubis attested by a third-century dedication in Thessalonike (across the Thermaic golf from Dion), which was set up by a cultic association of Hermanubis on behalf of certain individuals. This document and the personal name, along with a statue of the god from the Sarapeum of Carthage (LIMC n. 15), suggest that the cult of Hermanubis enjoyed some popularity outside its original home in the Roman period.[23]
